definitions.definition: a change that makes something more accurate than it was before

examples.text: I've made a few small corrections to your report.
The paper had to publish a correction to the story.
I've got to make one or two small corrections to the text before it's finished.
Make any necessary corrections before the text is printed.
Now is the time to make any course corrections.

definitions.definition: the act or process of correcting something

examples.text: There are some programming errors that need correction.
The work was returned the student for correction.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin correctio(n-), from corrigere ‘make straight, bring into order’, from cor- ‘together’ + regere ‘guide’.
